strEMatrixDateFormat

public static java.lang.String strEMatrixDateFormat
This is the default for fixing Time zone issues the format is been changed to MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss a static public String strEMatrixDateFormat = "EEE MMM d, yyyyy hh:mm:ss a zdddd";

Constructor Detail

eMatrixDateFormat

Method Detail

setEMatrixDateFormat

public static void setEMatrixDateFormat(java.lang.String param)
This substitute of TimeZone is been used because the time zones read from matrix are not matching with java time zones at times. in those cases we are ending up getting either null pointer exception or StringIndexOutOfBoundsException the solution for this problem at present is to change the time zone came from matrix to the server time zone. or don't get the time zone from matrix and append with server time zone Currently we solved this problem by not getting time zone from core. In this the assumption is both server and core are in same time zone. The code change SimpleDateFormat mxDateFrmt = new SimpleDateFormat (eMatrixDateFormat.getEMatrixDateFormat()); currentTime = mxDateFrmt.parse(modifyDate, new ParsePosition(0)); should be replace with currentTime = eMatrixDateFormat.getJavaDate(modifyDate); The page should have import of com.matrixone.apps.common.taglib.* as <%@ page import = "com.matrixone.apps.common.taglib.*" %> eMatrix.ini change is MX_NORMAL_DATETIME_FORMAT= moy/dom/yr4 h12:min:sec +mer emxSystem.properties change is eServiceSuites.eMatrixDateFormat = MM/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss a insted of eServiceSuites.eMatrixDateFormat= EEE MMM d, yyyyy hh:mm:ss a z

getDateValue

public static java.lang.String getDateValue(Context context,
                                            java.lang.String msvalue,
                                            java.lang.String timeZone,
                                            java.util.Locale locale)
Method to get Display Formatted date given milliseconds, timezone and locale The display date format is obtained from the system property

Parameters:
context - the eMatrix Context object
msvalue - String milliseconds
timeZone - String timeZine used for formatting
locale - Locale to be used for formatting
Returns:
String - formatted Date string
Since:
AEF 11
